item.title: Barriers and signs for works left at site since January, 10th June
item.description:
After works to fix the steps on this footpath were completed (fix my street ref 6899947), January 2025, the barriers and signs have been left in a hedge just off the road on the pathway, blighting the footpath from Hartley to Coberley. this has been 6 months. Please collect them. See photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Markings clear but ignored daily, 9th June
item.description:
If you are coming from fiddlers green or Churchdown onto the A40 (golden valley), the road markings show lane 1&2 going to the arle court P&R, B&Q and ONLY lane 3 to go round the roundabout onto the dual carriageway to M5/Gloucester. However daily cars from lane 2 also turn right and often drift into the second/third lane on the entry to the above mentioned dual carriageway. If there were also signage to support the markings I think this would be a less often occurrence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: 20 potholes in half mile of Park Lane, 9th June
item.description:
From the Brockhampton Park crossroads up to Babbage/the Deer Park drive there are 11 potholes, from Babbage up to No.1 Park Lane there are a further 9. For most of the potholes there is hardly any road surface left. What3Words for a few of the areas ///airbrush.devoured.month and ///firming.umbrellas.stub

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Surface is damaged problem, 9th June
item.description:
Email received 05/06/2025 - copy attached: Hi team I've been advised that you are able to help with correcting the pathway in The Minster Churchyard Cheltenham. We see that there has been some utilities work at the Well Walk end of the churchyard pathway. We see that the utility chaps have put down black tarmac on the pathway â€“ rather than the carefully selected resin-type surface. It is also noted that the brickwork paving on Well Walk has been put down a little unevenly, but better than before. The double yellow lines have been reinstated. It was raised at the end of February that the whole of Well Walk needs attention, including the yellow lines which have largely disintegrated. I understood that GCC are responsible for the lighting and pathways in The Minster Churchyard, as GCC was involved in the recent project to rejuvenate the area. This was in conjunction with Cheltenham Borough Council, The Diocese of Gloucester and our Church Council. If you could look in to this - particularly the reinstatement of the original pathway surface to match. It should also be noted that any work in The Minster grounds need acknowledgement from the church as it is a closed churchyard and still contains burial remains.
Report on FixMyStreet
